file_content.text: I will never be able to thank you enough for saving my Lela.
You've done better than I ever expected.
My friend Jed, his wife and both his daughters have come home. Tana Moss, too.
I notice there's one name you left off that list....
What about your daughter?
I... I guess she didn't make it.
And the reward?
Yes, as I promised, for each woman who returned.
There will always be pirates here. You should learn to defend yourselves.
You're still in danger.
You're right. Get an HK droid, maybe two. If we ever get running again, we'll be prepared.
But I must ask... my Lela, was there no sign...?
Papa! Papa!
Lela! Oh, my Lela, are you alright? If they hurt one hair on your--
Shh. It was... awful. But we don't need to worry anymore. I don't think your friends left enough of them to get revenge on.
Thank you, Master Jedi. When you walked in, it was like something out of a fairy tale.
Thank you, sir. I'll never say anything bad about soldiers again.
I don't think I can ever thank you enough.
Thank you. That was just amazing having you burst in there like some holodrama hero. What's your name?
That's enough. Don't go being too grateful.
Listen to your father. You're not looking for another pirate.
I'm not right for you.
Thank you. I'm a father. I can't help it.
Thank you. Thank you so much.
I'm just glad to see you home safely.
You're welcome.
It was nothing.
This looks like a private family moment. I don't want to intrude.
My work here is done.
You've given me back the only important part of my life. I can never thank you enough.
Now go to Anchorhead, love. I don't want you out here until this place is secure.
I don't know what brought you to Tatooine, but I'll be grateful every day that you were here.
Please hurry. The girls could be shipped off-planet any time now.
I can't possibly say how glad I am to see the lot of you.
Master Jedi, you are the answer to my prayers.
Sir, if I could have anyone on this planet walk by right now, you'd be my top choice.
I don't know who you are, but... you look a good sort. I think.
I--I've lost everything. My daughter... can you find it in your heart to help me?
First, tell me what happened. Did someone attack you?
I will do what I can.
Help with what?
This is my farm. Yesterday, we had a dozen droids and fifteen workers collecting enough moisture for half of Anchorhead. Today, everything's gone.
Just what I need. Another sob story.
Help yourself.
This is no "sob story"! My farm, my life's work, everything was destroyed. And my daughter....
See this moisture farm? I built it with my own hands.
The pirates destroyed it. They took the droids, the harvesters. And when that wasn't enough... they took slaves.
My daughter, every woman here, my neighbors' wives and kids. The pirates carried them off like livestock!
No man or woman should be held in bondage to another.
I will return them to you.
You're everything they say a Jedi should be. If you tell me my Lela will come home, then I believe you.
Calm your anger, my friend. Your daughter will return.
I will rescue them.
I'll try, but I'm no Jedi. I'm just a man with a child he'd kill to save.
No galactic citizen gets sold into slavery on my watch.
I'll get them back.
Thank you, sir. You make me want to join the Republic.
Stealing's one thing. Even I draw the line at slavery.
Maybe I can help.
Those scum who took Lela, they're the lowest of the low.
I wish I could help you. I wish I knew more. I always thought if I ignored the raiders, they'd return the favor.
Does this "help" you want come with a price tag?
What are they worth to you?
I keep my profits in Anchorhead. That's what made the pirates so mad. No cash on hand, so they took my Lela instead.
If you can get her back, get any of them back, I'll give you a reward for every one you rescue.
I can tell you where those scum bed down... I just pray my poor Lela is still there.
Not my job. [Refuse quest]
But... they could be off-planet by nightfall! Please! My daughter's only sixteen...!
The pirates could be back any minute!
